state.dialog: A trouble maker are we?! After making that sort of name for yourself, well, someone ought to be keeping an eye on you...
There is no need for thanks, rogue one.
You lean forward into the stark emptiness and grab the only thing that seems to exist before you: a tattered sword. Perhaps it may be of some use to you...
That sword is the weapon of your character. It may aid you on your quest if you so choose.

I have summoned you here as the savior of the Below. No one short of myself has ever made it this far unto the Realm of Creation. Your conciousness even just existing here is an anomaly curious enough with you as rogue as you claim.

I am... a creator. Yours, specifically. I have summoned you as the savior of the Below, another creation that has begun to stray from my design. Even being as rogue as you say, I am forced trust you to bring peace once again.

The Below is a realm of beings, some quite like yourself. It, like all things, was created. It started as a relatively peaceful place, but after going out on a a bit of a bender and creating 'free will'... Well, things have gotten out of hand, but that's what you're here for.

Creation? How do I say... Well everything is created. By what or whom and where is up for much debate, but for certain, I created you here, In the Realm of Creation: the clay-like beginning-realm for all of my creations. You, rogue one, were created to bring peace to the Below once more.
Oh just spendid! Off you go!

You pull yourself away from my voice but find there is nothing else to run towards. There is nothing but us here in the Realm of Creation. As you run further into the expansive whiteness, you find your sanity begin to slip. In the endless void of white... Who am I? Who are you? Perhaps I should have summoned another... Goodbye rogue one. Goodbye.

You begin the seemingly endless plummet out of the white abyss of the Realm of Creation. The white fades into a pleasant gradient of blue as you begin to see color for the first time. The greyish hues of your body change to the diverse tones of flesh. You begin to forget you're falling as you examine your newfound body. You begin to feel as though you're being submerged until suddenly...
You awake as the sunrise flutters into the windows of a strange room. You have no idea where you are, or how you got there, but one thing is for certain... You have a splitting headache.
If your head was not ringing enough, it certainly is now. After the auditory asault, you see a woman running out of the corner of your eye, only to then see a castle guard standing over you.
You there! What do you think you are doing?! Give me your name before I take you straight to the barracks!
You there! What do you think you are doing?! Give me your name before I take you straight to the barracks!
